meanings.definition: A person who holds a second job in addition to their main job.
meanings.sent1: The moonlighter at the diner also worked as a cashier during the day.
meanings.sent2: My neighbor is a moonlighter, delivering newspapers early in the morning before going to his office job.
meanings.sent3: The moonlighter who was a teacher by day, turned into a superhero by night to fight homework villains.
meanings.sent4: She was a moonlighter, a secret agent in the shadows of the night, while appearing as a librarian by day.
meanings.sent5: The moonlighter's double life as a chef and a taxi driver made for an interesting story.

meanings.definition: To work a second job in addition to one's main job.
meanings.sent1: After finishing his shift at the factory, he would moonlighter as a security guard at the mall.
meanings.sent2: She decided to moonlighter as a tutor to earn extra money for her vacation.
meanings.sent3: The cat would moonlighter as a detective, investigating mysterious disappearances of toys in the house.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden seemed to moonlighter as dancers, swaying gracefully in the evening breeze.
meanings.sent5: The stars in the sky would moonlighter as tiny lanterns, guiding travelers through the darkness.
